729588f-a.title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
729588f-a.text:
St. Marks Place, west side, between Fort Place and Wall
Street, showing the McKee Vocational High School. The view is
north from Fort Place.
June 22, B)SP
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729588f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY

729583f-b.title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
729583f-b.text:
(1)
326 St. Marks Place, east side, at the head of Fort
Place, showing the ''Bella Vista,' built in the Norman-French
style of architecture. The chateau was owned by Mrs. J. C.
Thompson, in 1874; by Fred Tiedmann, in 1898; and by Richard
Agar, in 1907.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Another view, seen from Nyatt Street.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO RE:RODUCTIONS
2SO E S
Nea 2 E947
729583f-b.folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY

729581f-a.title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Forts Place
729581f-a.text:
302 St. Marks Plaoe, adjoining the N.W. corner
of Fort Place, showing the Staten Island Masonic Club.
The house was owned by the Carrere family from 1898 to
1917 (see map of above years).
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729581f-a.folder: St. Marks Place & Forts Place, Staten Island, NY

729587f-b.title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
729587f-b.text:
St. Marks Place, at the S.W. corner of Fort Place,
showing two views of the Brighton Heights Reformed Church.
View 2 shows the Fort Place side of the edifice.
March 16, 1940
Views 1, 2
Gift of Albert Norman
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE.
729587f-b.folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY

728854f-a.title: Richmond: Fort Place - St. Marks Place
728854f-a.text:
Fort Place, adjoining the N.W. corner of St. Marks
Place.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
728854f-a.folder: Fort Place & St. Marks Place, Staten Island, NY
